intro: Antirrhinum neglectum, commonly known as the common toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Antirrhinum neglectum is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open woodland areas.
